intro: Haplophyllum ferganicum, commonly known as the Fergana rock rose, is a perennial shrub native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, helping to reduce water loss. The flowers, which range from pink to red, bloom in late spring and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
